pageContext.claim: “They're not coming up for asylum. They're coming up for money.”
pageContext.analysis: Many Central Americans are attempting to immigrate to the United States to attain better economic conditions. But not all of them. A wealth of evidence -- reports by NGOs, assessments by the UN, and immigration court records in the United States -- shows that many of these would-be immigrants have legitimate claims to asylum based on threats to their safety in their home countries.
